channel.title: [ Learn Hacking ] Where should you start?
channel.description:
Hello Hackers !
In this topic, I will share you some link and some tips on how to find good resources to learn "Hacking"
The first thing to do is maybe learn a programming language
I start in learning C when I was younger but I didn't go too deep in this programming language. A good starting point could be learning basic scripting language.
- [Python](http://learnpythonthehardway.org/book/) - [Ruby](http://learnrubythehardway.org/book/) - [Bash](http://cli.learncodethehardway.org/bash_cheat_sheet.pdf) *cheat sheet* - Powershell
With some scripting knowledge you'll be able to make your own tools for hacking or at least understand the code of open source tools.
Now that you now some basic programming language, I suggest you to learn web hacking : - [Root-me](https://www.root-me.org/) (French & English ) - [HackThisSite] (https://www.hackthissite.org/) ( English ) - [Newbie-contest] (https://www.newbiecontest.org/) (French & English) These 3 link can help you understand some of the basic attack, they are good challenge on basic web attack *sqli, xss, csrf, etc ..*
Now if you really want to go deeper in hacking, you should try to do some CTF - [Vulnhub](https://www.vulnhub.com/) is a good start - [Metasploit 2](https://sourceforge.net/projects/metasploitable/files/Metasploitable2/) download link *Maybe I'll do a Write up on Metasploitable 2*
and you will need to understand code and binaries : - [LiveOverflow](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClcE-kVhqyiHCcjYwcpfj9w) youtube channel - [Protostar](https://exploit-exercises.com/protostar/) A vulnerable vm
And the last resource is **Google** *You want to find a good pdf about python ?* type in the searchbar : intext:python filetype:pdf you will find a lot !
If you have more information or more link you could share it !
@L3akM3-0day

item.title: [ Learn Hacking ] Where should you start?
item.dc:creator: Shellsquid
item.description:
@nullbyte9955 that depends on what you want to do or what you mean by “hacking a mobile”.

You could do that even without knowing anything about a language as there are several tutorials on exactly this topic. Just create a payload with meterpreter and send it to the mobile. However, that requires interaction (some social engineering) from the owner of the phone. Then you’re able to almost control the phone from your computer/phone.

PS: Those mobile payloads are written in Java.

Read full topic

item.title: [ Learn Hacking ] Where should you start?
item.dc:creator: Merozey
item.description:
I think it’s quite difficult for one to tell someone else which path they should choose, because there are too many programming languages, concepts and areas to cover to provide one path. My advice would be to clarify with yourself what it is you want to achieve and then learn the necessary tools and what not.

Read full topic

item.title: [ Learn Hacking ] Where should you start?
item.dc:creator: L3akM3-0day
item.description:
Hello Hackers !

In this topic, I will share you some link and some tips on how to find good resources to learn “Hacking”

The first thing to do is maybe learn a programming language

I start in learning C when I was younger but I didn’t go too deep in this programming language. A good starting point could be learning basic scripting language.

  • Python
  • Ruby
  • Bash cheat sheet
  • Powershell

With some scripting knowledge you’ll be able to make your own tools for hacking or at least understand the code of open source tools.

Now that you now some basic programming language, I suggest you to learn web hacking :

  • Root-me (French & English )
  • [HackThisSite] (https://www.hackthissite.org/) ( English )
  • [Newbie-contest] (https://www.newbiecontest.org/) (French & English)
    These 3 link can help you understand some of the basic attack, they are good challenge on basic web attack sqli, xss, csrf, etc …

Now if you really want to go deeper in hacking, you should try to do some CTF

  • Vulnhub is a good start
  • Metasploit 2 download link Maybe I’ll do a Write up on Metasploitable 2

and you will need to understand code and binaries :

  • LiveOverflow youtube channel
  • Protostar A vulnerable vm

And the last resource is Google
You want to find a good pdf about python ?
type in the searchbar : intext:python filetype:pdf
you will find a lot !

If you have more information or more link you could share it !

@L3akM3-0day
